business.headline: Sensex, Nifty rise over 1% in fifth-day rally led by banking, IT gainsThe S&P BSE Sensex added 855.30 points to close at 79,408.50, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 273.90 points to end at 24,125.55.

Klaus Schwab steps down as World Economic Forum chairThe WEF thanked Schwab for his 55 years of dedicated leadership and for building what has become a premier global platform for dialogue and progress.

India hopes to seal US trade pact this year: Finance Minister Nirmala SitharamanNirmala Sitharaman is on a five-day trip to the United States, where she will attend the spring meetings of the International Monetary Fund and the World Bank, and the meeting of G20 finance ministers and central bank governors.

HDFC Bank, ICICI Bank hit record highs after strong Q4: Buy, hold or sell?HDFC Bank rose 1.3% while ICICI Bank gained 0.9% by 9:40 am. Their gains helped lift the Nifty Bank and Nifty Private Bank indices by nearly 2%, and pushed the Nifty 50 up 0.6%, with heavyweight HDFC Bank emerging as the index's top driver.

Sensex soars 1,000 points: Why is stock market rising today?Stock market today: The rally on Monday marks the fifth straight session of gains, showing that investor confidence is returning. Both Sensex and Nifty touched their highest levels since January 6.

Explained: Why Yes Bank share price rose nearly 7% todayThe Yes Bank stock was trading at Rs 18.95 on the BSE, marking a 4.75% jump. Gains continued through the morning, with the stock touching an intraday high of Rs 19.37, indicating that it rallied nearly 7%.

Stock market rally: Should investors consider small-cap, mid-cap stocks?With strong institutional inflows and improved breadth in the market, analysts say the coming weeks could favour investors who are selectively increasing exposure to quality names in the midcap and smallcap universe.

Gold price nears Rs 1 lakh-mark amid global uncertainty. Should you buy or sell?Gold price today: Monday's jump follows a dip in the previous session, where MCX Gold fell 0.44% to Rs 95,239 due to profit booking. But the broader narrative remains dominated by geopolitical and macroeconomic anxiety.

'Era of salaryman is over': Saurabh Mukherjea warns India's middle classSpeaking on a recent podcast titled Beyond the Paycheck: India's Entrepreneurial Rebirth, Saurabh Mukherjea issued a clear and unsettling warning: salaried employment, long considered the golden path to financial security, is dying.
Sensex, Nifty rally as strong Q4 results from banks lift market confidenceThe S&P BSE Sensex gained 635.70 points to 79,188.90, while the NSE Nifty50 added 200.30 points to 24,051.95 as of 10:33 am.

Stock market opening today: Will Sensex, Nifty continue their winning rally?Sensex, Nifty today: While strong results from HDFC Bank and ICICI Bank may help, weak global cues and disappointing Q4 results from Infosys could hold back gains.

Stocks to watch on April 21: TCS, Infosys, Gensol Engineering, HDFC Bank, IndigoShares of several major companies such as TCS, Inofsys, HDFC Bank, ICICI Bank, BHEL, Gensol Engineering, IndiGo, among others, will be in focus on April 21.

Gensol faces government inquiry after Rs 975 crore EV loan misuse: SourcesAccording to sources, the MCA's move is an independent action aimed at investigating potential corporate governance lapses and financial irregularities. There is no fixed timeline for the inquiry.

India-US trade talks from April 23, tariffs, customs negotiations on agenda: ReportThe Indian official team is visiting the US to give further impetus to the negotiations in the 90-day tariff pause window and discuss these terms of reference to iron out differences on certain issues.

Ford pauses shipments of SUVs, sports cars and other models to ChinaFord has halted exports of key US-built vehicles to China amid rising tariffs and trade tensions, impacting a once-profitable segment of its business, WSJ reports. Engine shipments, however, continue.
No GST on UPI transactions over Rs 2,000, government clarifiesUPI payments, especially those made to merchants, currently don't attract any extra charges like GST.

ICICI Bank cuts FD and savings rates. Check what's newIf you have a savings account with ICICI Bank, you'll now earn slightly less. For balances below Rs 50 lakh, the new interest rate is 2.75% per annum, down from 3%.

Infosys lets go of 240 new recruits, offers free upskilling: ReportThe impacted employees joined the company in October 2024 as part of a training batch. The freshers were hired for two roles; System Engineers (SE) and Digital Specialist Engineers (DSE).

Nvidia to keep serving Chinese firms despite massive AI chip export lossHuang's statement comes at a time when the United States has tightened rules around exporting advanced chips to China. The restrictions, announced under the Donald Trump administration, are part of an ongoing trade war between the two countries.

Want to change your tax regime while filing ITR? Here's what you should knowLet's say you had earlier chosen the old tax regime, but now the new regime appears more beneficial after reviewing your finances. Can you change it when filing your ITR? Let's find out here.

TCS denies job bias against US employees, calls allegations 'misleading': ReportThe complaints have mostly come from workers in the US who are over 40 and not of non-South Asian ethnic backgrounds. They believe TCS chose them for layoffs during the tech industry slowdown, while keeping younger Indian workers on H-1B visas.

How Jaggi brothers squandered borrowed money, killed BluSmartSebi's interim order exposed how the Jaggi brothers may have taken investors for a ride, not in an EV, but in a web of financial mismanagement.
Can you open two PPF accounts? Check detailsThe combined yearly deposit in both your PPF account and that of your child's account cannot go beyond Rs 1.5 lakh.

Trump started the tariff war. Now a weak dollar has him on the back footAs Trump's tariff strategy faces mounting challenges, a weakening dollar and rising inflation threaten to undermine his economic goals, forcing the US into a precarious position as global trade tensions escalate.

IMF backs India's stance on tariffs, presses US-China on fair tradeAmid rising global tensions, the IMF sees India's moves on tariffs as a rare bright spot, urging the world's largest economies to rebuild trust and strengthen a fair trade system.

Life insurance claim rejected? Here's how to get it correctGetting an insurance claim approved has become a nightmare nowadays. Nithin Kamath, in a post, also said that many avoid life insurance because policies as they are confusing and getting harder to understand.

Good Friday 2025: Are Sensex and Nifty closed for trading today?This week has been a short one for stock market participants. The markets opened only for three days, from April 15 to April 17. They were shut on Monday, April 14, in observance of Dr. Baba Saheb Ambedkar Jayanti.

Thumbay International Research Grant awards 14 projects at Gulf Medical UniversityThe 14 selected projects, led by top researchers from institutions like Harvard Medical School, University of Arizona, and Regensburg University, were chosen for their exceptional quality and originality.

Trump's tariffs could hurt US, but an opportunity for India: Ruchir SharmaRuchir Sharma believes India's emerging role in global trade could reshape its economic future, with a potential influx of investment as the US faces trade challenges and shifts in global capital flows.

Opting for new tax regime? Check out these 5 benefitsThe revisions introduced under the new tax regime aim to make the new regime easier, cut down on paperwork, and minimise the confusion many individuals experience in filing their returns.

Infosys Q4 results: Profit drops 12%, final dividend set at Rs 22The IT major clocked revenue of Rs 40,925 crore for the March quarter, up 8% from Rs 37,923 crore a year ago. In constant currency terms, revenue grew 4.8% YoY but declined 3.5% sequentially.

No public listing in 2 months: Where have IPOs disappeared?Just nine companies have listed on the mainboard till April this year, compared to 25 in the same period last year, and most didn't even leave a mark.
Sensex, Nifty rebound to end nearly 2% higher as banking stocks rallyThe S&P BSE Sensex ended 1508.91 higher at 78,553.20, while the NSE Nifty50 settled 414.45 points higher at 23,851.65.
Sunscreen faceoff: Honasa vs HUL in court over ad claimsThe core of the argument is SPF, the sun protection factor which measures how well a sunscreen protects against harmful UV rays.

Flipkart ends WFH policy, asks all employees to work from office: ReportFlipkart had initially offered flexibility to employees during the pandemic. But over the past year, the company began rolling back the policy in phases—first calling senior executives back to office. Now, the mandate applies to all employees, regardless of role or function.

Vijay Kedia warns of 10 red flags to spot a potential scam amid Gensol fraudInvestor and market expert Vijay Kedia has warned that Gensol is not the only company with problems amid the findings by Sebi.

Rs 25 lakh in India or $100K in US? Bengaluru techie weighs in on what's betterChoosing to stay in India means staying close to family, celebrating festivals, and living within a culture you know well, said the tech professional.

PhonePe rolls out UPI Circle, simplifies payments for family and friendsUPI Circle is a feature by NPCI (National Payments Corporation of India) where a primary user gives permission to a secondary user to make payments from their UPI account, within set limits.

Sebi's job is to find and punish them: Tuhin Kanta Pandey on Gensol fraudThe Securities and Exchange Board of India (Sebi) released an interim order on April 15, stating that Gensol Engineering's promoters, brothers Anmol and Puneet Singh Jaggi, had diverted company funds for personal use.

Surprise rally lights up Dalal Street, Sensex jumps 1,500 points. Here's whyShare market today: Despite a slight uptick in volatility, sentiment turned decisively positive as fears around global trade tensions began to fade. Broader market indices joined the rally, reflecting widespread optimism among investors.

entertainment.headline: Rajkummar Rao set to replace Aamir Khan in Ujjwal Nikam biopic: ReportActor Rajkummar Rao is in talks to play prosecutor Ujjwal Nikam in an upcoming biopic. Aamir Khan, who was originally playing the part, has stepped down and will now produce the film alongside Dinesh Vijan.

Babil Khan on seeking his mother's validation: Baba did the same with his motherBabil Khan, son of the late actor Irrfan, continues to seek his mother Sutapa's validation in all aspects of his life, much like his father did. Currently, he is celebrating the success of his latest film Logout, which recently premiered on Zee5 .

Jr NTR to begin shooting for Prashanth Neel's film on April 22 in KarnatakaThe makers have released a picture featuring Jr NTR and Prashanth Neel ahead of the new shoot schedule, where NTR is set to join the team on April 22.

Allu Arjun's look test for Atlee's film kickstarts in Mumbai: ReportAllu Arjun and director Atlee are currently in Mumbai prepping for their upcoming film, 'AA 22'. Reportedly, they are working on the look test and concept shoot.

Jonathan Pryce to Robbie Coltrane: Hollywood actors who played Pope on screenPope Francis died on April 21, weeks after battling double pneumonia. With the death of the 88-year-old spiritual head, take a look at all the Hollywood stars who played the Pope on-screen.

Ugramm to Apthamithra: 5 Kannada films that deserves a re-release in 2025Since the re-release trend is going strong across the country, here are 5 Kannada films that deserve a grand re-release in Karnataka, just like Puneeth Rajkumar's 'Appu', in 2025.

Why Ralph Fiennes' Conclave matters in a post-Pope Francis eraPope Francis' sudden death during Easter has left the world in shock. As the Vatican prepares for the conclave, questions arise about the future of the Catholic Church.

Actor Samantha reflects on her early roles: Feel embarrassed watching them nowActor Samantha, during a recent college visit for her film promotions, candidly spoke about her experience as a producer and admitted feeling embarrassed about her early acting performances.

Randeep Hooda, family meet PM Modi: His pat on the back is great encouragementActor Randeep Hooda, along with his mother and sister, met Prime Minister Narendra Modi in New Delhi. He shared pictures from the meet and greet on social media.

Malayalam actor says she won't take legal action against Shine Tom ChackoMalayalam actor Vincy Aloshious met the media in Kerala and said that she will not take the legal route against co-star Shine Tom Chacko. She stated that she wanted to solve this issue within the film industry.

Jacqueliene Fernandez visits Siddhivinayak Temple with Elon Musk's mother Maye MuskJacqueliene Fernandez spent Easter at Siddhivinayak Temple with Elon Musk's mother Maye Musk, marking a shift from her usual family church tradition, as she copes with personal loss.

Seema Sajdeh reflects on split with Sohail Khan: An affair is not a deal-breakerActor Sohail Khan's ex-wife Seema Sajdeh opened up about their separation, admitting she felt helpless when she realised she had to take care of herself.

Rana Daggubati attends WWE WrestleMania 41 in Las Vegas, promotes Rana NaiduActor Rana Daggubati celebrated a milestone moment as he became the first Indian celebrity to be officially invited to WWE's WrestleMania41. He promoted his Netflix show, 'Rana Naidu', in Las Vegas.

Imran Khan's ex-wife Avantika opens up about divorce: I felt I wouldn't surviveAvantika Malik shared her experiences and challenges following her separation from actor Imran Khan. She reflected on the emotional toll, their co-parenting strategy, and personal growth post-divorce.
Dhanush's Idly Kadai set catches fire in Tamil Nadu, no injuries reportedDhanush's upcoming film 'Idly Kadai' set caught fire in Tamil Nadu. As per reports, no casualties have been recorded.

Sussanne Khan thanks Ram Charan for visiting new store, thanks him for his graceTelugu superstar Ram Charan recently visited interior designer and Hrithik Roshan's ex-partner Sussanne Khan's design studio, The Charcoal Project, in Hyderabad. Sussanne's actor-brother Zayed Khan was also present.

Actor Hayden Christensen confirms return as Anakin Skywalker in Ahsoka Season 2Actor Hayden Christensen is set to return as Anakin Skywalker in the second season of 'Ahsoka', as announced during the Star Wars Celebration in Tokyo.

KGF actor Yash to begin Ramayan shoot, visits Ujjain's Mahakaleshwar temple'KGF' actor Yash sought blessings at Ujjain's Mahakaleshwar temple on Monday. He is gearing up for the shooting of his upcoming film, 'Ramayan', by director Nitesh Tiwari.
Rani Mukerji's Mardaani 3 to release on Holi 2026, first look outRani Mukerji's first look from 'Mardaani 3' is finally out. The film will release in theatres on February 27, 2026.

general news.headline: PM to hold talks with JD Vance soon under shadow of Trump tariffs, trade deal Live Updates US Vice President JD Vance, along with his wife Usha Vance and three children, is on a four-day visit to India. This marks his first official visit to the country.

JD Vance arrives at PM Modi's residence, talks to begin shortlyUS Vice President JD Vance and family arrived in New Delhi this morning for a four-day official visit to India, marking his first trip to the country since assuming office. Vice President Vance is scheduled to meet Prime Minister Narendra Modi later this evening. High on the agenda will be the ongoing negotiations for a long-anticipated bilateral trade agreement, as well as the status of President Donald Trump's reciprocal tariffs on Indian goods. These measures, currently on hold until July, have remained a key sticking point in trade talks and are expected to feature prominently in Vice President Vance's official engagements.
Pope Francis dies aged 88, day after celebrating EasterThe 88-year-old Pope Francis died on Monday, the Vatican announced, weeks after battling double pneumonia.

Poisoned, held hostage: Ex-Karnataka top cop's wife in messages before murderDisturbing messages, reportedly sent by Pallavi, former Karnataka DGP Om Prakash's wife and the prime accused in his murder, showed she believed she was constantly under surveillance, long before she allegedly stabbed him.

Why Ralph Fiennes' Conclave matters in a post-Pope Francis eraPope Francis' sudden death during Easter has left the world in shock. As the Vatican prepares for the conclave, questions arise about the future of the Catholic Church.

'You DRDO people': Air Force officer left bloodied, wife insulted in road rageA Defence Research and Development Organisation (DRDO) Wing Commander posted a video on social media after facing a road rage incident in Bengaluru. In the video, he said he and his wife, a Squadron leader, were verbally abused in Kannada and the Commander was attacked leading to severe injuries on his face and neck.

Pope Francis is dead. What's next?Pope Francis' passing triggers centuries-old Vatican rituals that honour his legacy and mark the end of an era. As the Roman Catholic Church mourns and prepares for a historic conclave, a new chapter in faith and leadership is set to begin.

Ex-Karnataka top cop was having lunch when wife stabbed him: SourcesMore details uncovered during the ongoing investigation into the murder of former Karnataka Director General of Police (DGP) Om Prakash show that he was seated at the dining table having lunch when he was stabbed.

Walking is wonderful, but won't keep you fully fitFor beginners or sedentary (inactive) individuals, walking can kick-start improvements in blood circulation, mobility, and mental health. However, as you progress in your fitness journey, your body demands more to stay strong and functional.

Khalistani group won't be able to swing Canada election: Ex-envoy BisariaFormer Indian High Commissioner to Canada, Ajay Bisaria, said the "disproportionate capture" by an active Khalistani group in Canada won't impact the April 28 election. He said this was the time to stabilise Indo-Canada relations.

Ground Report: Death of Pope Francis leaves his followers in disbeliefPope Francis, 88, who was recovering from double pneumonia, has died at his residence in Casa Santa Marta, the Vatican said. Despite his declining health, Pope Francis made a rare appearance in a wheelchair on Sunday. In his final message, he stressed the critical need for freedom and peace, urging the world to reflect on these values amid ongoing global conflicts.

How Ishan Kishan got back his central contract: BCCI retainership explainedThe BCCI on Monday, April 21, announced annual retainership contracts for 34 senior men's team players. Ishan Kishan was handed back his contract despite not having played for India since November 2023.
Watch: Women climb down dry well as Nashik village faces severe water crisisWith no other option, women are forced to descend into dry and crumbling wells just to fetch a few pots of water.
Pope Francis's last message to the world: A word on peace, freedom and religionPope Francis dies at 88, a day after delivering a final Easter message calling for peace, freedom, and global unity.

Congress must know its past: BJP posts old Indira Gandhi clip amid judiciary rowIn the video, Indira Gandhi is seen questioning the setting up of the Justice Shah Commission to probe the excesses and malpractices during the Emergency period.

Pope Francis dies: Who could head the Catholic Church next?The election of a new pope is steeped in centuries-old Vatican tradition and ceremony. Following the death of a pontiff, the responsibility of choosing his successor falls to the College of Cardinals-specifically, those under the age of 80.

Myanmar earthquake was so powerful satellites saw the ground movingOriginating just 10 kilometers beneath the surface along the Sagaing Fault, the seismic events caused severe shaking, widespread building collapses, and infrastructure damage.

Neeraj Chopra Classic in Bengaluru: Have invited Arshad Nadeem, says javelin starThe inaugural edition of the Neeraj Chopra Classic, a one-day javelin throw event, will be held in Bengaluru on May 24. Top athletes, including Anderson Peters and Yulius Yego, are expected to compete. Neeraj said he has invited Olympic champion Arshad Nadeem of Pakistan.

Delhi man signs up as Blinkit delivery agent, says untouchability isn't just caste-basedA Delhi-based man swapped his desk job for a day to work as a Blinkit delivery agent, and came back with a reality check most people choose to overlook.

'Tu bahar mil': Man threatens judge in courtroom after she rules against himThe outburst took place before Judicial Magistrate (NI Act) Shivangi Mangla, who had on April 2 convicted the accused under Section 138 of the Negotiable Instruments Act - the law dealing with dishonour of cheques.

Usha Vance in fiery red, kids in desi outfits arrive in Delhi with JD VanceUS Second Lady Usha Vance arrived in Delhi with her husband, JD Vance, and their kids. While she opted for a western look, she made sure the kids embraced their mother's desi roots.

I killed the monster, ex-Karnataka top cop's wife told friend on video call: CopsIn a stunning twist in the murder case of former Karnataka Director General of Police (DGP) Om Prakash, his wife reportedly phoned the police and confessed to the killing. Meanwhile, their son has filed a formal complaint, alleging that both his mother and sister may have been involved.

'Hinduphobia': Khalistani extremists vandalise Hindu temple, gurdwara in CanadaThe Laxmi Narayan Mandir in Surrey and a gurdwara in Vancouver were defaced with pro-Khalistan graffiti by suspected Khalistani extremists.

Watch: Virat Kohli's Punjabi banter with Harpreet Brar during PBKS vs RCB gameIndia and Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) batter Virat Kohli was seen having a banter with Punjab Kings' (PBKS) spinner Harpreet Brar in Punjabi during Match 37 of the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025).

sports.headline: Sabalenka suffers shock defeat as Ostapenko wins Stuttgart OpenJelena Ostapenko defeated Jelena Ostapenko 6-4, 6-1 in the final and won the Stuttgart Open title. The Latvian also won her first clay-court title since the French Open in 2017.

Neeraj Chopra Classic in Bengaluru: Javelin star offers glimpse into dream projectIndia's most decorated Olympian Neeraj Chopra, in collaboration with JSW Sports, announced the launch of India's first-ever International Javelin competition, the Neeraj Chopra Classic 2025. The two-time Olympian, speaking to the press, shared updates about his 'dream' project, scheduled to be held on May 24 in Bengaluru.

Sudirman Cup 2025: Satwik-Chirag ruled out as India suffer big blow aheadIndia suffered a big blow ahead of the start of the Sudirman Cup 2025 as men's doubles pairing of Satwiksairaj Rankireddy and Chirag Shetty have been ruled out of the tournament due to sickness.

2025 Boston Marathon: Start time, TV channels, weather and all you need to knowThe Boston Marathon is one of the world's most iconic races. The race is held annually on Patriots' Day in Massachusetts. This year marks the 129th iteration of the race. With the runners preparing to race from Hopkinton to Boylston Street.

Sanju Samson will not travel to Bengaluru for RCB vs RRRajasthan Royals captain Sanju Samson will not be travelling to Bengaluru to play the team's next game against RCB. The Royals revealed the information on Monday, April 21 and explained that the batter was still recovering from his injury.

KKR vs GT Live: Wounded Kolkata aim to bounce back against GujaratIPL 2025, KKR vs GT Live Score: Kolkata Knight Riders will look to make amends from their 16-run defeat to Punjab Kings while Gujarat Titans will aim to solidify their position at the top of the table.

How Ishan Kishan got back his central contract: BCCI retainership explainedThe BCCI on Monday, April 21, announced annual retainership contracts for 34 senior men's team players. Ishan Kishan was handed back his contract despite not having played for India since November 2023.

Rohit Sharma thanks Abhishek Nayar after smart knock vs CSKIPL 2025, MI vs CSK: Rohit Sharma scored a brilliant 76 off 45 balls and helped Mumbai Indians beat the Chennai Super Kings on Sunday, April 20 at the Wankhede Stadium in Mumbai.

Gillespie breached contract: PCB hits back over non-payment allegationsPakistan Cricket Board has hit back at former coach Jason Gillespie over allegations of non-payment of dues. PCB put out a statement slamming Gillespie, and stated that the Australian had breached their contract.

CSK's auction strategy slammed by Raina, Harbhajan: Ignored Pant, Rahul, ShreyasCSK's strategy during the IPL 2025 auction has been slammed by ex-players Suresh Raina and Harbhajan Singh after their embarrassing loss to MI on Sunday, April 20. Raina feels CSK let go of a lot of players during the auction.

2025 Stanley Cup Playoffs: Date, time, games, schedule, TV channels, and all you need to knowThe 2025 NHL Stanley Cup playoffs start this Saturday, April 19, and the stage is set for one of the most unpredictable and exciting postseasons in recent years. With traditional powerhouses like New York, Boston, and Chicago missing the cut, the spotlight now turns to fresh contenders.

How Ishan Kishan got back his central contract: BCCI retainership explainedThe BCCI on Monday, April 21, announced annual retainership contracts for 34 senior men's team players. Ishan Kishan was handed back his contract despite not having played for India since November 2023.

Rohit Sharma thanks Abhishek Nayar after smart knock vs CSKIPL 2025, MI vs CSK: Rohit Sharma scored a brilliant 76 off 45 balls and helped Mumbai Indians beat the Chennai Super Kings on Sunday, April 20 at the Wankhede Stadium in Mumbai.

Gillespie breached contract: PCB hits back over non-payment allegationsPakistan Cricket Board has hit back at former coach Jason Gillespie over allegations of non-payment of dues. PCB put out a statement slamming Gillespie, and stated that the Australian had breached their contract.

CSK's auction strategy slammed by Raina, Harbhajan: Ignored Pant, Rahul, ShreyasCSK's strategy during the IPL 2025 auction has been slammed by ex-players Suresh Raina and Harbhajan Singh after their embarrassing loss to MI on Sunday, April 20. Raina feels CSK let go of a lot of players during the auction.

2025 Stanley Cup Playoffs: Date, time, games, schedule, TV channels, and all you need to knowThe 2025 NHL Stanley Cup playoffs start this Saturday, April 19, and the stage is set for one of the most unpredictable and exciting postseasons in recent years. With traditional powerhouses like New York, Boston, and Chicago missing the cut, the spotlight now turns to fresh contenders.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
